titleStmt.title: John L. Sallee to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1706

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Monticello Ky Oct 26th 1863
His Excellency Thos E Bramlett

Owing to there having been no writ of Election to fill office of Justice of the Peace at the May and August Elections in Wayne we have no Justices in the County The Court at the August Term Last took the Subject under advisement and recommends to your Excellency the following names for commission but I am somew what at a loss to know whether such Power is confered upon the county court be that as it may I give you the list and you can come there or not

1st Dist X H Stephens J J Garth x H Marshall
2 " X Robt C McBeath Jno Brammer
3 " X D L Powers Micah Huffaker
4 " X Garner Prmley Thos Ryan David Bell X
5 " X Thomas Powell X L W Morrow
6 " Jno T Nichols Jacob Molen X R M Tate
7 " James Dolen Jno Luallen
Those marked with a star are rebels and I suggest the names of M Marshall Thos Ryan & R M Tate in their Stead

very Resplly
Jon L Sallee clk
W C Court

Wayne County
J. P
Apptd
5th Jany 1864
